title: Lumpia in the Air Fryer Recipe
description: This recipe for lumpia in the air fryer results in the same crispiness without having to deep-fry. Easy to make with your favorite filling!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Wraps and Rolls Lumpia in the Air Fryer 4.6 (7) 3 Reviews 3 Photos This recipe for lumpia in the air fryer results in the same crispiness without having to deep-fry. Your taste buds will never know the difference, but your waistline will! Submitted by Yoly Updated on November 15, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 16 lumpia Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings 1 pound Italian hot sausage links ½ cup finely sliced green onions ½ cup finely chopped carrots ½ cup finely chopped water chestnuts ¼ cup diced onions 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 tablespoons soy sauce ½ teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon ground ginger 16 spring roll wrappers avocado oil cooking spray Directions Remove casing from sausage and cook in a skillet over medium heat until slightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Add green onions, carrots, water chestnuts, and onion. Cook and stir until onions are soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Season with soy sauce, salt, and ginger. Stir until filling is well combined; remove from heat. Lay a spring roll wrapper at an angle. Place a scant 1/4 cup filling in the center of the wrapper. Fold bottom corner over filling and tuck in the sides to form a roll. Use your finger to lightly moisten edges with water. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling. Mist each roll with avocado oil cooking spray. Preheat an air fryer to 390 degrees F (198 degrees C). Place lumpia rolls in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching; cook in batches if necessary. Fry for 4 minutes; flip and cook until skins are crispy, about 4 minutes more. Cook’s Note I used a mini food processor to chop the carrots and water chestnuts. name: Yoly
instructions: Remove casing from sausage and cook in a skillet over medium heat until slightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Add green onions, carrots, water chestnuts, and onion. Cook and stir until onions are soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Season with soy sauce, salt, and ginger. Stir until filling is well combined; remove from heat.;Lay a spring roll wrapper at an angle. Place a scant 1/4 cup filling in the center of the wrapper. Fold bottom corner over filling and tuck in the sides to form a roll. Use your finger to lightly moisten edges with water. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling. Mist each roll with avocado oil cooking spray.;Preheat an air fryer to 390 degrees F (198 degrees C).;Place lumpia rolls in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching; cook in batches if necessary. Fry for 4 minutes; flip and cook until skins are crispy, about 4 minutes more.
